prompt: A regular octagon has the same perimeter as the regular hexagon shown here with side length 16 cm.  How long is each side of the octagon? [asy]size(80); pair A = dir(120); pair B=dir(60); pair M=(A+B)/2; draw(dir(360)--B--A--dir(180)--dir(240)--dir(300)--cycle); label("16 cm", M, N);[/asy]
output:
To find the side length of the regular octagon, we first need to understand that the perimeter of a regular polygon is the sum of the lengths of all its sides.

The given hexagon has a side length of 16 cm. A hexagon has 6 sides, so its perimeter (P_hexagon) can be calculated as:

\[ P_{hexagon} = 6 \times \text{side length} = 6 \times 16 \, \text{cm} \]

Now, we are told that the regular octagon has the same perimeter as this hexagon. An octagon has 8 sides. If the octagon's perimeter (P_octagon) is equal to the hexagon's perimeter, we can set up the equation:

\[ P_{octagon} = P_{hexagon} \]
\[ 8 \times \text{side length of octagon} = 6 \times 16 \, \text{cm} \]

Let's solve for the side length of the octagon:

\[ 8 \times \text{side length of octagon} = 96 \, \text{cm} \]
\[ \text{side length of octagon} = \frac{96 \, \text{cm}}{8} \]
\[ \text{side length of octagon} = 12 \, \text{cm} \]

So, each side of the regular octagon is \(12 \, \text{cm}\).

\boxed{12 \, \text{cm}}
